In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it in Julia using DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x)->Dates.format(x,"y"), df[:dt]) * map((x)->Dates.format(x,"m"), df[:dt])
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym`. The values in this new column are the concatenation of year (obtained using "y" format specifier) and month (obtained using "m" format specifier) from each DateTime value in `dt`.

For example, if df is:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()+Month(i) for i in 1:3])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
Then df will be:
```julia
| dt                 | ym   |
|-------------------|------|
| 2022-02-05T08:49:56.713 | 202202 |
| 2022-03-05T08:49:56.713 | 202203 |
| 2022-04-05T08:49:56.713 | 202204 |
```
